Event.name: Mass_motion
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Mass_theme</fen>, generally made up of many individuals, moves from a <fen>Source</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen> with some <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Mass_theme">Emails from so-called Nigerian princes</fex> <t>flooded</t> <fex name="Goal">inboxes</fex> <fex name="Area">all over the US</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The place where the overall motion event takes place, thus including Source, Path, and Goal locations.
<ex>Letters <t>streamed</t> in <fex name="Area">all over the country</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Speed
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which motion occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The Source is the location the Theme occupies initially before its change of location.
<ex>Afterwards, the crowd <t>flooded</t> <fex name="Source">away from the ceremony</fex>. </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Path refers to (a part of the) ground the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> travels over or to a landmark the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> travels by.
<ex>The door opened , and a crowd of people <t>flooded</t> <fex name="Path">past me</fex>, into the hall.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Goal is the location the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> ends up in.
<ex>Eager spectators <t>crowded</t> <fex name="Goal">into the auditorium</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Distance
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion. This frame element occurs throughout the motion domain but is very infrequent in Motion.Noise. The engine <t>spluttered</t> forward <fex name="Distance">a short way</fex> and stopped. </def-root>

Arg.name: Mode_of_transportation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Mass_theme</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'.
<ex> Fans <t>poured</t> in <fex name="Mode_of_transportation">by boat and train</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the motion event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Mass_theme</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully)
<ex>Children <t>crowded</t> <fex name="Manner">eagerly</fex> around us</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The spatial setting in which the Mass_motion takes place.
<ex><fex name="Place">In the main auditorium</fex> people <t>crowded</t> around Orange's newest computer</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Direction
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the <fen>Goal</fen> of the posture change nor a landmark along the way of the moving part of the body. Often <fen>Direction</fen> is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the <fen>Mass_theme</fen>, or the orientation imposed by an implicit observer.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>In cases wherein the <fen>Mass_theme</fen> is construed as a sentient entities, this FE denotes the state of affairs that the entities wish to bring about by mass movement.
<ex>The ducks <t>flocked</t> south <fex name="pur">to mate</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: swarm.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move somewhere in large numbers.

lexUnit.name: teem.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move as a large, flowing group

lexUnit.name: throng.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: flock or be present in great numbers.

lexUnit.name: stream.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a mass of people or things) move in a continuous flow.

lexUnit.name: crowd.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move or come together as a crowd.

lexUnit.name: flood.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: arrive in or overwhelm with very large numbers.

lexUnit.name: pour.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of people or things) come or go in a steady stream.

lexUnit.name: flock.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: congregate or move in a flock.

lexUnit.name: troop.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come or go together or in large numbers.

lexUnit.name: parade.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: move as a groop (as if) on display

lexUnit.name: rain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall or cause to fall in large quantities.

lexUnit.name: hail.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: fall destructively in copious quantities.

lexUnit.name: shower.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fall, throw, or be thrown in a shower

lexUnit.name: pelt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of rain, hail, or snow) fall very heavily.
